unnormalised: Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Quality Control Crucial for Festive Season Surge
normalised: Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Quality Control Crucial for Festive Season Surge

unnormalised: As Onam approaches, manufacturers across Kerala and beyond are ramping up production. Ensuring rigorous quality control is paramount, especially with the increased demand for festive goods, from textiles to ingredients for the perfect Onam Sadhya.
normalised: As Onam approaches, manufacturers across Kerala and beyond are ramping up production. Ensuring rigorous quality control is paramount, especially with the increased demand for festive goods, from textiles or ingredients for the perfect Onam Sadhya.

unnormalised: Experts at IIT Madras are advocating for implementing statistical process control (SPC) to minimize defects. SPC, a technique using data analysis, helps monitor production lines and identifies potential issues before they escalate.
normalised: Experts at I I T Madras are advocating for implementing statistical process control (S P C) to minimize defects. S P C, a technique using data analysis, helps monitor production lines and identifies potential issues before they escalate.

unnormalised: "Imagine a batch of biryani masala with inconsistent spice levels," explains Dr. Sharma from NIT Trichy, "Without quality control, consumers receive a subpar product, damaging brand reputation and potentially leading to recalls."
normalised: "Imagine a batch of biryani masala with inconsistent spice levels," explains Doctor Sharma from N I T Trichy, "Without quality control, consumers receive a subpar product, damaging brand reputation and potentially leading to recalls."

unnormalised: Simple checks like regular equipment calibration and employee training can make a significant difference. Companies like Tata Steel have demonstrated that investing in QC drastically reduces costs associated with rework and customer complaints. Effective quality control ensures customer satisfaction and safeguards the bottom line.
normalised: Simple checks like regular equipment calibration and employee training can make a significant difference. Companies like Tata Steel have demonstrated that investing in Q C drastically reduces costs associated with rework and customer complaints. Effective quality control ensures customer satisfaction and safeguards the bottom line.
